{{Infobox software | name = JRDF | logo = | screenshot = | caption = | latest_release_version = 0.5.6.1 | latest_release_date = May 30, 2010 | operating_system = [[Cross-platform]] | genre = [[Semantic Web]] | license = [[BSD-style license]] | website = {{URL|http://jrdf.sourceforge.net/}} }}
'''JRDF''' is an [[open source]] [[Resource Description Framework|RDF]] framework for [[Java (programming language)|Java]]. It provides an object oriented model of [[Resource Description Framework|RDF]] graphs including [[URI]]s, Literals and [[Blank node|Blank Nodes]]. It was initially released in 2003 from work on the TKS and Kowari triple stores (later [[Mulgara (software)|Mulgara]]) in order to provide an [[API]] that could be used to bridge other [[API]]s such as [[Jena (framework)|Jena]] and to model [[Resource Description Framework|RDF]] concepts.<ref>[http://lists.w3.org/Archives/Public/www-rdf-interest/2003Dec/0050.html JRDF - Announcement]</ref> These [[API]]s allow [[Resource Description Framework|RDF]] to be created and written using various formats such as N3 and RDF/XML. It has an implementation of [[SPARQL]] although it is not complete. [[Resource Description Framework|RDF]] graphs can be stored in memory or on disk through various persistence layers. In 2008, JRDF implemented a triple store across [[Hadoop]] using a technique called RDF molecules.<ref>[http://www.itee.uq.edu.au/~eresearch/papers/2008/newman_et_al_www2008.pdf A Scale-Out RDF Molecule Store for Distributed Processing of Biomedical Data]</ref>
JRDF is similar to other frameworks such as [[Jena (framework)|Jena]] and [[Sesame (framework)|Sesame]] although it does not currently provide support for OWL ([[Web Ontology Language]]).
==See also== * [[Jena (framework)|Jena]] * [[Sesame (framework)|Sesame]]
